free_text.Prerequisite for: Master projects in the areas of power systems and energy conversion systems.
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Energy conversion, circuit and systems, electrical machines.
free_text.Content: The course is divided in three parts, namely: (i) models of distributed energy conversion systems for electricity production, (ii) modeling of distributed storage systems and (iii) analysis and control of active distribution networks.[br/]1.	Models of distributed energy conversion systems for electricity production[br/][tab]1.1.	Wind generators[br/][tab]1.2.	Photovoltaic systems[br/][tab]1.3.	Mini-hydro generators[br/][tab]1.4.	Heat-and-power co-generation units[br/][tab]1.5.	Fuel cells systems[br/]2.	Modeling of distributed storage systems[br/][tab]2.1.	Classification of storage systems as a function of their energy and power densities[br/][tab]2.2.	Electrochemical storage systems[br/][tab]2.3.	Hydrogen cycles[br/][tab]2.4.	Supercapacitors[br/][tab]2.5.	Compressed-air storage systems[br/][tab]2.6.	Flywheels[br/]3.	Analysis and control of active distribution networks[br/][tab]3.1.	Advanced power systems modeling[br/][tab]3.2.	State estimation[br/][tab]3.3.	Phasor Measurement Units and monitoring of active distribution networks[br/][tab]3.4.	Control of active distribution networks[br/][tab]3.5.	Network protections[br/][tab]3.6.	Grid codes[br/]
free_text.Learning outcomes: The course focuses on the different aspects related to the distributed generation of electricity by means of renewables and non-renewables energy conversion systems. Particular consideration will be given to the aspects related to the dynamic behavior of the distributed energy resources and their interconnection to electrical grids. Concerning this last point, advanced monitoring and control methodologies in steady-state and transient conditions of power distribution grids will be illustrated in detail.

free_text.Prérequis: Conversions d'énergies, circuits et systèmes, machines électriques
free_text.Forme d'enseignement: Ex cathedra. Exercices sur papier et à l'ordinateur

free_text.Préparation pour: Projets de master dans les disciplines: réseaux électriques et de systèmes de conversion d'énergie
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Le cours est centré sur les différents aspects relatifs à la génération distribuée au travers des systèmes de conversion d'énergies renouvelables et non renouvelables. L'accent est mis sur les aspects portant sur le comportement dynamique des différentes ressources et de leur interconnexion aux réseaux électriques. Pour illustrer en détail ce dernier point, le cours se concentrera aussi sur les méthodologies de contrôle de monitoring avancé des réseaux électriques de distribution.
